repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Heinrich Necheles (1897-1979) was a physician and researcher in gastroenterology. He taught at Peking Union Medical College in China from 1924-1931 and then was a physician at the Michael Reese Hospital in Chicago. The collection contains autobiographies of Heinrich and his wife Stephanie Necheles (born 1901), privately published in 1988. They are Autobiographical Reminiscenes by Heinrich Necheles and My Life's Journey: Berlin, Chicago, Walnut Creek. A Memoir by Stephanie Necheles.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Heinrich Necheles (1897-1979) was a physician and researcher in gastroenterology. He taught at Peking Union Medical College in China from 1924-1931 and then was a physician at the Michael Reese Hospital in Chicago. Necheles' wife Stephanie was born in 1901.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains autobiographies of Heinrich and his wife Stephanie Necheles (born 1901), privately published in 1988. They are Autobiographical Reminiscenes by Heinrich Necheles and My Life's Journey: Berlin, Chicago, Walnut Creek. A Memoir by Stephanie Necheles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Heinrich and Stephanie Necheles Papers, 1988. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Necheles Papers).
